1122251792966922247.text:
"Yeah, so I found out my new house is haunted."
"You know who you should call? Ghostbusters!"
"Oh? Do they have an email address?"
"Just call them!"
"Ah. Can I text them?"
"No, just call them."
"Um. Never said I minded the ghost. It's not that bad."

Polkadot is a totally open-source, permissionless platform. 

You don't need permission to:
- own DOTs
- validate on Polkadot
- vote on Polkadot
- be on the Polkadot council
- bid on a parachain slot
- deploy/operate a parachain 
- use a parachainpic.twitter.com/JS19nQPaYU

986657904739737601.text: This reminds me of time banking, where hours are exchanged for hours. E.g., someone cooks a meal for a busy family and then pays that time to someone to fix a fence. I loved time banking in SF because I got to share skills I rarely contribute to the regular economy.

986650986965012480.text: "Money is a tool, a societal agreement. Instead of a top-down distribution, it could be created by people through code. So why not create and distribute money fairly by giving the same amount to every account in a system?” —Harriet von Froreich @CirclesUBIhttps://www.fastcompany.com/40516337/with-this-cryptocurrency-everyone-gets-paid …
